title.narrative: Midterm Review of Organisation Strategy for Denmark's Engagement with Global Environment Facility (GEF) and Least Developed Countries Fund 2018-2022

description.narrative:
The midterm review will consider progress in Danish cooperation with the GEF and LDCF against the five DAC criteria: i) Relevance, ii) efficiency, iii) effectiveness, iv) sustainability, and v) impact. And it will assess the extent to Denmark, in collaboration with other like-minded countries has succeeded in facilitating linkages and synergies.
The mid-term review is not as such an assessment of the performance of the GEF, for which Denmark and other contributing donors rely on a number of other assessments such as the MOPAN, extensive annual reports and evaluations, including those from the Independent Evaluation Office (IEO) and the comprehensive evaluations that are performed every four years to provide solid evaluative evidence to donors. These evaluations provide an independent assessment of performance and results of the GEF over a GEF replenishment period. The comprehensive evaluations assess the extent to which the GEF is achieving its objectives and identify potential areas of improvement.
